subHeader: To know how FusionCharts works, it is important to understand the various components and concepts of a chart

content.header: Below you can find different sections with interactive annotated images describing various components and concepts of charts

annotations.annotationDesc: The caption (also called the chart title) is the heading of your chart, you can add custom text for the caption, as well as configure its font properties and cosmetics.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: Font properties and cosmetics of caption can also be customized using attributes, know more about them
You can also customize the alignment of the caption. Learn more about it

annotations.annotationDesc: The sub-caption (also called the chart subtitle) is the sub-heading of your chart. You can add custom text for sub-caption, as well as configure its font properties.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: Font properties and cosmetics of sub-caption can also be customized using attributes, learn more about them

annotations.annotationDesc: Canvas area refers to the area in which the chart data is plotted, excluding the area where titles, legends, and axis names are rendered.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: You can customize border for canvas, learn more about it
You can customize background color for canvas, as well as add gradient fill to it. Learn more about it

annotations.annotationDesc: X-Axis refers to line or values on a chart that runs horizontally (left-right). Learn more about it
X-Axis refers to title of the x-axis. Learn more about it
X-Axis labels are the names of the data points that are displayed on the x-axis of a chart. Learn more about it
Y-Axis refers to line or values on a chart that runs vertically (up-down) through zero. Learn more about them
Data plot refers to the columns of the column chart, lines in a line chart, pie/doughnut slices in a pie/doughnut chart.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: You can customize the way your data plot looks using colors, gradients and hover effects using available attributes, learn more about their usage

annotations.annotationDesc: Each data point in a line/spline/area chart is represented by an anchor. Anchors help to identify the data point in the chart easily. Learn more about it
Cross line is a vertical line/area used as a quick reference for data plots. Learn more about it
A tooltip is displayed when the mouse cursor hovers over a particular data point. It denotes valuable information about the data plot hovered. Learn more about it

annotationLinks.linkDesc: You can customize padding, size and other properties of tooltip, learn more about it
You can also customize the text of tooltip and use values plotted on the chart using macros, learn more about it
